comment.text: Amazing food not much else to say!!! We got the comfy chicken and enchiladas. Do yourself the favor and go!

Good atmosphere with weird but fun art on the walls. Great service bbuuuttt the food was just okay. I cook and I do it well, I also eat well and I know good quality,  the food here was just okay. Nothing much more to say. I wouldn't recommend this place but at the same time I wouldn't not recommend it. Plate and eat at your own risk maybe you'll hit the jackpot that I clearly missed.

Damn! The food here is so good! There's no reservations so you come in and put your name down. On a Sunday morning, the wait was about 30 to 40 minutes and I came in 15mins before closing. I'm sure it's even longer earlier in the morning. Even still, it will be worth the wait. Definitely try their fried chicken and fresh orange juice. This was hitting for my hangover. Everything on the menu looked great though, there's def no bad choices here.

They definitely need to beef up on gleaning and sanitation. It's an old landmark eatery that hasn't seen a good dusting since it opened. Yuck! The kitchen is less than desirable. It's a gag....I was so disappointed.

We decided to come here during our visit to Atlanta. It was the only breakfast we would have in Atlanta and we wanted Southern food. Home Grown did not disappoint! So delicious!

I got the BBQ Shrimp and Cheddar grits. They served a large portion I couldn't finish, but it was absolutely unbelievable. My husband ordered the Comfy Chicken. That is fried chicken over biscuits covered in sausage gravy. While this is not my thing, he said it was amazing and finished the whole large plate. We ordered fried green tomatoes as an appetizer. The batter was delicious.

It was a little difficult to get a table it took us about 40 minutes and this was our second attempt in the month and the time was the same. So this time we decided to stay and see what the buzz was about. They don't have a conventional system to keep up with waiting. they just have a piece of paper and a pen and someone calling names. All that doesn't even matter because when you sit down enjoying the fresh squeezed orange juice and taste this biscuit with this gravy and amazingly better chicken everything about your wait time was completely irrelevant and worthy. This is definitely one of my favorite spots in Atlanta is it is country and southern if you know the difference. So the food is rich and comforting. Highly recommend the spot.

photos.caption: Comfy fried chicken pork sausage gravy and biscuit. This was pretty good. The gravy and chicken batter are def the star.

comment.text: The Comfy Chicken might be the best fried chicken, biscuit and gravy combo I've ever had. Get there early because many people know about this hidden gem. Great waitstaff as well.

Excellent! I had the BLT and it was full of flavor and delicious . My brother in law got the chicken n waffles also amazing! My husband got the breakfast special which looked super yummy. The service was great. The bathrooms were clean and the whole restaurant has great local artwork to purchase. A great spot in ATL

Outstanding spot for brunch. We came on a Sunday and we're quoted an hour wait. Fortunately, the wait was only about 30 minutes. We walked around the neighborhood and there is a trail nearby to pass the time.

We shared the breakfast tacos and the comfy chicken and biscuits with sausage gravy. The breakfast tacos were good. I'd recommend a few drops of hot sauce to really elevate them. The chicken and biscuits were outstanding! Some of the best that we've had. Super savory. Biscuits were pillowy. 

I also really enjoyed their unsweetened ice tea.

Home Grown was the perfect breakfast place for my husband and I. The service was very welcoming and the service was quick! Our waiter, Kevin, was quick on refills and letting us know the status of our food. As far as the food goes it was just as excellent. I had the chicken gravy biscuit and my husband had the Nannie's breakfast, both were delicious and were huge portions. We also shared a pancake, which might have been the best pancake I've ever had. I would definitely recommend this place for your next breakfast date!

Have been here twice and both times have been nothing but great. The food is always good and service is always friendly. A little old school diner and not updated but it's clean and comfortable. The last time I got a chicken, egg & cheese biscuit and it hit the spot. Recommend friends when visiting Atlanta and will continue to go when I visit.

My favorite brunch spot. Very homey. The food is GOOD GOOD. My go to is their fried pork chops and friend catfish. I usually get potatoes but everything is good. The service is fast and fair. It get busy so go early or with patience. The bar is first come first serve so that's nice. Oh yeah and the fried liver is awesome too lol and the smothered biscuit

I think homegrown was good but definitely not great- to be fair a say disclaimer I have very high brunch standards. Recommended as "the best brunch in ATL" and the "best chicken waffles" I had high hopes but our party of 4 each thought our meals were average. I had the vegetarian biscuits and gravy which was filling but extremellyyy salty. The biscuit was perfect however! Chocolate chip pancake on the side was yummy but a little on the dry side. My husband liked his chicken and waffles and thought the chicken was well spiced and moist but the waffle was flat, and didn't find it special that any other spot. Our other party members had cheesy grits were were good and breakfast tacos which were just OK. We had no real complaints but everything was just very very heavy and not necessarily special or well balanced. I don't know if I'd hype it up to others or even come back myself. I will say I loved the vibe and the music playing was awesome. We only waited 20 mins on Saturday mid morning though I've heard wait times can be much longer.

So glad we drove out of the way to eat here after seeing it on yelp!  This is some of best breakfast food we've had and we love breakfast. The basic breakfast was cooked perfectly - grits melted in my mouth and the bacon was perfectly crisp not limp and greasy like so many breakfast restaurants. And the biscuit will rival your granny's!  My husband got the comfy chicken and biscuit and didn't leave a drop! We'll be back!

First time at Home Grown and it won't be my last! We ordered the comfy chicken biscuit, chicken and waffles, and their fried green tomatoes. The food was pretty hearty, but I enjoyed it a lot. 

Comfy Chicken Biscuit- the gravy was so good, even by itself. Together with the chicken and biscuit... I just wanted to savor every bite. I even put some of that gravy onto the fried green tomatoes... it was so good. 

The fried green tomatoes had the right amount of crisp and crunch in every bite. I really like the breading. I wished there were more slices (only 3),but I'd still recommend it. It's a good appetizer! 

Chicken and Waffles- the waffles.. the waffles! I was suppose to just have a bite, because I was so full. But I couldn't help but finish a portion of the waffles. I have no regrets! 

I already know what I want to try next time!

photos.caption: Comfy Chicken Biscuit, Chicken & Waffles, Fried Green Tomatoes

comment.text:
The best brunch place in Atlanta, absolutely hands down. The chicken biscuit is amazing and the fried green tomatoes are fantastic. I have gotten the Bagel Sammy as well and the garlic cheese spread lives in my dreams. Staff are incredibly nice; I've sat at the bar twice when I've gone and they're so supportive and great, and the other customers are so welcoming. 

Parking is rough and there's usually a long wait, but it's SO WORTH IT!!!! now my absolute favorite place in Atlanta.

Now for me there is very few restaurants that go into my list of,if your from out of town you gotta eat here. Homegrown is one such place though. I've always been greeted and felt welcomed by their staff. Now sometimes there is a wait ,cause there food is on that ,talk to Jesus level.you know,you take a bite,but then your about to die,so you holler out,hold up Jesus I wanna finish this before I'm called home. Now I will admit their portion sizes have seem to have gotten smaller over time. They give you plastic utensils, this makes eating things like eggs abit difficult to eat.(pandemic protocol I assume) However the quality of the food is always great. Yep if you visiting Atlanta this place is definitely worth stopping by.

photos.caption: Porkchop with sausage  gravy,eggs over easy,home fries,rye toast and sweet tea.

comment.text: Best breakfast food in Atlanta! Be sure to try to the burgers! It's usually very busy on the weekends so plan ahead!

Usually this place is packed. Upon my first visit, the wait was so long I had to come back another time. My first time eating at Home Grown was amazing. The wait was only like 5 minutes. This was during the beginning of March, before Covid-19 got bad here in ATL. They were wearing gloves and sanitizing everything properly. The food was the best. The chicken biscuit was some of the best chicken I have ever tasted!! I will definitely be coming back to try the lunch menu! My experience went as good as it could go, from polite staff to fresh, great tasting food! 

YES YES YES, You must go eat at Home Grown! 
Beware: parking lot is tight, might have to park on the street behind Home Grown or a block over.

photos.caption: Fried chicken biscuit with home fries

comment.text: Home grown is one of the most charming old-timey diners in Atlanta! Sitting at the counter, you'll get the full experience of hospitality from the staff here. The menu was composed of both breakfast and brunch selections, and I started off with the egg biscuit and ham biscuit sandwiches, each built on a fluffy, soft homemade biscuit. For a particularly Southern dish, I tried the Lynne Stack, composed of a salmon patty, a slice of fried green tomato, sautéed spinach, and roasted tomatoes, all covered in melted pimento cheese. The salmon patty had a nice meaty texture and seafood flavor, and the fried green tomato came with the most delicious crispy, spicy, peppery breading. The vegetables added a nice earthy, bright flavor to the dish, but the highlight was the melted pimento cheese, which had a slightly spicy flavor and thick, creamy texture. The server described this brunch plate as a "flavor bomb," and on that front, it certainly did not disappoint!

photos.caption: Lynne Stack: salmon patty, fried green tomato, sautéed spinach, roasted tomato, melted pimento cheese

comment.text: Long wait time but worth it! Cool interior and delicious food. For vegetarians, I suggest the veg biscuits and gravy add veg sausage.

I have eaten here a few times and the food was always good. The servers were always pleasant. When it's very busy, you will need to be patient. WARNING... the pancakes are HUGE. That are good and big enough to share. I don't like crispy bacon and I make sure to mention it when ordering - asking that my bacon be medium and it was cooked to order just the way I like it every time. 

I want say thank you to management. On my last visit someone tried to save a parking space for someone in their party that wasn't in the parking lot. I called to ask if it was part of their policy to do so. Management came out to speak with me and answered all of questions pertaining to the situation. With everything cleared up I felt comfortable staying and enjoyed a warm hearty meal. 

If you are looking for a place with nice people and good food priced right I recommend checking them out. Enjoy!!

The waiter was amazing. 
I've passed this place plenty of times & this is my first time stopping by.

I love the cute decor it's so cute.

I ordered the comfy chicken biscuit with vegan gravy . Never again lol. Next time I'll get it without vegan gravy! 

The chicken biscuit would've been good but the gravy was over powering.

photos.caption: Comfy chicken biscuit with white vegan gravy

comment.text: Pretty dang good food and seriously the best and most creative ambiance...I time travel. Be ready to wait, but it's worth the wait. I haven't found my staple dish yet, but I'll keep trying until I do!

I only ate here once but the food was great and the customer service was amazing!
Salmon Patties

I've eaten there at least bimonthly for the last decade. Everything and I repeat everything on the menu is tasty and cooked to perfection. My go to dish is the Chicken Comfy biscuit with the vegan gravy (heaven).

Homegrown is my favorite breakfast place. It's normally crowded but they get you seated very quickly. I've tried almost everything there. From the fried fish to the fried bologna sandwich. Both was amazing! If you want a great breakfast, definitely stop at homegrown!

They do not disappoint!  I have been at least 5 times and every time I've ate here I have felt like I had a good home cooked meal.  Yes the parking is terribly close and depending on when you go the wait may be a lil long but it is so worth it.  I do not have pics of my food because I ate it!

Went here for a second time this weekend. It's phenomenal. A perfect representation of Atlanta - hip, southern, edgy charm. Best fried pickles I've ever had. I get country fried steak biscuits and gravy - sooo good. Prices are great and love all the artwork. A perfect place to bring out of town guests for some good southern breakfast.

My favorite spot for brunch. Yummy food. Diverse crowd. Always packed on the weekends. But after 1, crowd dies down.. You can order to go and pick it up. But sometimes the waiting experience there is cool. I love the pork chops... they're my fave. Defly an ATL go to casual brunch spot.

I enjoyed this cute little hipster spot. They offered quick service and hot food. The food tasted good and the service was great. I'd go back and try different dishes! It's a small spot with minimal seating, it has a nice homely feel!
Their food is the true meaning of comfort food. Delicious. Their service is always spectacular!
Home Grown can be crowded at times but for good reason. Classic diner and one of my favorite breakfast spots.

Their comfy chicken biscuit was everything I wanted! The gravy was not too heavy (which usually happens). The biscuit was full of fluff and airiness and their chicken was NOT dry. I also ordered a peach pancake to share. The chicken biscuit alone was enough to fill me up! The pancake alone probably would've also filled me up considering it's the size of the plates there. Pancake wasn't anything too special, but my cousin said she enjoyed and I quote "I'm usually not a pancake person."  Also, those oranges on the plate were so juicy that I wish I had gotten more!!!

Service was pretty quick. Place is HUGE compared to the storefront. Pay at register when you're finished which is INCREDIBLY nice instead one having to wait for the check to come. Parking lot was FILLED, but still plenty of room to enjoy the food.

I'm salivating just thinking about the biscuit!

Mostly great - couple okays. The service was great. The biscuits are great. The bacon was great. The french toast was very good - nothing overly special about it but still very good. The pancake was just okay - a little tough as if the batter had sat for a little too long.

Recently visited around 10am with a friend. Parking, as always, was a hit or miss. Didn't a space in the lot but found easily accessible street parking. Walked in and it was already buzzing with people. Waited about 10 minutes for a table so no problems there.

Immediately were given waters and attended by a waiter. He then took our orders. I got the French toast with bacon on the side and my friend ordered the popular comfy chicken biscuit. She thoroughly enjoyed it. My French toast was okay. They forgot to give me syrup on the side until halfway through I was able to get the waiter's attention to get some. He was apologetic and It helped the French toast a ton but overall pretty standard French toast. An easy option if you're looking for something lighter on this otherwise heavy menu. 

I'd definitely recommend coming here if you've never been for the eclectic charm this place has but otherwise I don't think the wait, parking, or food is worth reoccurring visits.

Quick and easy with outdoor seating. Waitress wore mask the entire time. It was 4 of us. The construction across the street made for conversation. Didn't get to see the inside. Orders were quick and lady was very friendly. 

Try the fried green tomatoes. My wife recommended I tried it. It comes in a batch of 3. Very good. 

Will return.
Do yourself a favor and get the fried green tomatoes and the fried chicken sandwich. YOU WONT REGRET IT.

photos.caption: Our Award Wining Ga Peach Sloppy Joe

comment.text:
I really like the food here (in particular the freshness of the chicken livers is only exceeded by one other local joint). My daughters, mother, and others I've taken for late breakfast also really enjoy the food and attentive service.

As a bonus, there's a small five-and-dime type local shopping experience near the rear, as well as some small art pieces hanging around that are available to purchase.

All in all I really like Homegrown and always recommend if someone is very close by.
OMG you must try their open face chicken biscuit that sausage gravy is so good. I definitely recommend and will try again.

Always a winner. Just the line and wait is ridiculous. one time we went they had a little "yard sale" w vendors. brilliant idea to keep guests distracted from the wait. if southern, country is your jam you'll love this eclectic spot.

Food was delicious! French toast is a nice amount, bacon crispy, eggs were okay. If you want eggs that's not liquid go with a fried egg. There potatoes with chili was good, just wish it was more. There chicken n biscuits had a good flavor, the gravy was just tooo thick for my liking. Only thing it's quite small and can get packed, so be mindful of that, so we got it to go, to lower our risk of exposure to COVID. Other than that, will go again to pick up a to go order for sure!!
This place might just be my favorite breakfast spot! Not only is the food delicious but it's also affordable! The portions are really good. I would highly recommend this restaurant!

We're from California and I was really looking to find a good southern breakfast place. I think I found it! I ordered the catfish and fried green tomatoes. It was delicious! The catfish was meaty and light, not heavy and greasy. The fried Green tomatoes were really different and I enjoyed them too. And I loved loved the grits - cheesy grits and the savory buttery grits! 
I also tried their fresh scallops Which were cooked medium rare and delicious! I would suggest sharing food to get a variety of items to taste - mmmmm.

photos.caption: Check in here when you arrive.
Grab and go area at the front.
Some of the art on sale in the far back of the restaurant
Seared scallops were really seared, not for anyone who is squeamish about rare/rawness in the scallop. Tasty seasoning!
So good...  Fried Catfish Fillet, savory grits, eggs over easy.

comment.text: Top Notch food for the soul. My favorite meal is enchiladas with eggs and extra cheese. The parking is limited so park across the street at the AMC garage and walk over. Thank me later.

I didn't really think much for this place when I saw it but I did notice how busy it was whenever I drove past this place! 

I am so glad I got to try this place!! It was fantastic. I've had their Comfy Chicken about three times now and it's always so good! The portion is perfect for a brunch. My boyfriend always sings about how good their comfy chicken is lol. 
Comfy chicken is a biscuit with fried chicken covered in pork sausage gravy.. like wow.. how good does that sound? I want some right now~
The bad thing about this place is the parking is really limited, the place is full every time I come.
I recommend you coming here and getting their comfy chicken!

Plain and simple but delicious and really nice staff. Our table of three shared the fried green tomatoes. Fantastic! Followed that with fried chicken and biscuits. By the way they have THE best biscuits. Period. Theirs are perfect. 
Anyway come as you are and enjoy!

My first introduction to Home Grown was actually at church.  The pastor mentioned the comfy chicken biscuit, waved his hand over his head, and said "praise the Lord.  Praise the Lord thoroughly."  That pretty much sums it up.

Funnily enough, it wasn't until 4 years later that my husband and I finally took the plunge and tried Home Grown (including the CCB) ourselves.  Whenever we drove past, we'd always seen the crazy long line and the small parking lot, so we never bothered with trying to get a table.  While taking a weekday Atlanta staycation, though, we figured we'd be able to handle a Monday morning crowd, and we went for our first visit.  Two days later, we visited again, it was that good and we wanted to try that many more dishes.

The food here is comfort food, and plenty of the dishes are heavy, but you can find lighter options if that's what you're into.  I'm totally down with heavy comfort food some days, so I loved it!  Strawberry pancakes, scrambles and omelettes, pork chops and grits and bagels and enchiladas and the blessed comfy chicken biscuit, you can't NOT find something you'll enjoy here.

I've now been 3 times, and the staff is always very welcoming.  We've noticed that they've saved a seat taken by one of their regulars even though he was taking a while to come back.  I always feel like part of the family when I come here.

The parking lot is small, but there's street parking nearby, too.  (And if you visit during May, you'll have mulberries and blackberries saying hello to you on the way to the restaurant.)

I don't think I've ever been during peak times, but I have had to wait in line twice.  Both times I had to wait in line, the line moved quickly.  Still, plan ahead so you don't get grumpy while waiting for your table.

I wish it hadn't taken me so long to visit!  Home Grown was an instant favorite and is still one of my top places for breakfast/brunch (and my other fave is Sun in My Belly).  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Basic breakfast (2 eggs cooked to order, choice of grits, choice of protein, and biscuit or toast) and pancake side (so big and tall)

comment.text:
My family dined here fir breakfast during our Atlanta vacation. I ordered the basic breakfast,my husband had the comfy chicken, my oldest had a bacon biscuit with additional sides, and youngest had the chicken and waffles. The food was absolutely delicious! In addition to this, the service was awesome. However, we did have one major issue during our visit. We asked that they move to Houston so we can enjoy them at home, but had no luck...bummer:(    

We will be back one day!

You'd be surprised to find there's great items on the menu other than the Comfy Chicken. However, I still get the Comfy Chicken almost every time because it's so darn good.

Tip: if you're a party of one or two, keep an eye out for a spot at the main counter. Saves you time and the staff are just so nice.
